item.title: Using 2 different coordinates at once

item.description:
@cheese8 wrote:

But that means if only one players step on either of the 2 coordinates, they will teleport without another players help. I want both players to have to be there for them to teleport.

item.title: Using 2 different coordinates at once
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

oh oh oh oh. ok i get it now. try this

if((playerPosX = 2490 && playerPosY = 10148) || (playerPosX = 2490 && playerPosY = 10146))
{
teleportToX = 2492;
teleportToY = 10146;
}

try that.

Read full topic

item.title: Using 2 different coordinates at once
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

ok so instead of making the coordinates the teleport, make the object the teleport. in your object cases, add this:

case (objectID):
teleportToX = 2492;
teleportToY = 10146;
break;

try that, and tell me if it works or not.

Read full topic

item.title: Using 2 different coordinates at once
item.dc:creator: @cheese8 cheese8
item.description:
@cheese8 wrote:

Like the Dagganoth cave in real runescape, how do you make it so when one player is at one coordinate, and the other player at another coordinate, make it so they both teleport somewhere?

This is what I have so far:

if ((absX == 2490 && absX == 2490 && absY == 10148 && absY == 10148) || (absX == 2490 && absX == 2490 && absY == 10146 && absY == 10146)) { String otherPName = playerName.substring(10); int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(otherPName); if(otherPIndex != -1) { client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex]; if ((p.absX == 2490 && p.absX == 2490 && p.absY == 10148 && p.absY == 10148) || (p.absX == 2490 && p.absX == 2490 && p.absY == 10146 && p.absY == 10146)) { teleportToX = 2492; teleportToY = 10146; } } }

I don’t get any errors, but when i log in with 2 people, they either both get disconnected, or when I go on the coordinates, everything disconnects.

Nobody knows??

Read full topic
